Caption:
HYBRID LECTURE AND DISCUSSION >
Dr Elizabeth Harris is President of the UK Association for Buddhist Studies and Honorary Senior Research Fellow at the University of Birmingham, having gained her doctorate in Buddhist Studies from the University of Kelaniya, Sri Lanka. A regular contributor to BBC Radio 4’s Thought for the Day, Elizabeth has written widely on Buddhist Studies and Buddhist-Christian issues.
When defending Buddhism against British colonialism, Anagarika Dharmapala sometimes spoke negatively about Christianity. Yet he accepted hospitality from Christians and talked with them with knowledge and respect. Dr Harris uses Dharmapala’s writings and unpublished diaries to explain what insights may be gained for today, reflecting on how interfaith relations can be both harmed and encouraged in the modern world.
The British MahaBodhi Society is delighted that the discussion on this important topic will be joined by Venerable Akurula Samitha from the Milton Keynes Vihara.
#buddhism #buddhiststudies #buddhistlecture #buddhistlectures

Caption:
## **梁長齡 (Liang ChangLing)**

Kwong Siew Association Pioneers. He is from Xinhui. A graduate of the University of Hong Kong, he once served as an inspector of schools in this country. Later, he left the educational field to enter business and was repeatedly elected as a member of the Selangor State Assembly. He served as the Cultural Director of the Malaysian Chinese Association (MCA) and as the Vice President of the MCA Selangor branch. He advocated for rural education and adult education classes. The Sultan of Selangor appointed him as a Justice of the Peace.

## **梁長齡**

廣肇先賢。新會人。畢業於香港大學，曾任本邦視學官，後棄儒就商，連任雪蘭莪州議員，馬華公會文化組主任、馬華公會雪分會副會長，倡辦鄉村教育及成人教育班。雪蘭莪蘇丹委他為太平局紳。

## Brief History

The “Guandi Temple,” also known as the [Kwong Siew Association], was established in 1888. A majestic and traditional Kwong Siew Association building was founded in Kuala Lumpur. In 1896, seven pairs of wooden columns were replaced with stone columns. In 1912, the association underwent repairs, including replacing the corridor tiles. In 1924, the back kitchen was demolished and rebuilt, adding another floor for storing equipment. Additionally, windows were added to the front corridor, and the horizontal entrance was modified. The wooden railings in the main hall were replaced with glass, and the atriums in front of the auxiliary shrines were covered with glass. Despite frequent repairs, the original design has largely remained unchanged.

## 簡史

“關帝廟”，又為[廣肇會館]於1888年(光緒14年)，一幢巍峨壯嚴古色古香的廣肇會館紮根在吉隆坡的土地上。根據議案在光緒廿二年(1896年)，有登記將會館內外薝口木柱7對，政換石柱，至民國元年修整會館，並將巡廊兩邊換瓦面，至民國十三年將後廚房拆去改建，並將大部分加建一層，放置用具，又將兩邊襯祠前廊開窗口，改橫門口，大堂前薝兩邊企陽拆開鑲玻璃，在後復將兩附祠前座天井用玻璃遮蓋，後座爐灶拆去，但歷年雖常加修理，而對於原來圖樣，驚無大變更。

Caption:
Our handcrafted Ashtamangala plate, adorned with the Eight Auspicious Symbols, is more than just a stunning wall decor piece. It embodies the essence of spiritual and material well-being rooted in Himalayan Buddhism.

The symbols include:

The Parasol: Offers protection from negative influences and symbolizes royalty.

The Pair of Golden Fish: Denotes spiritual release and fearlessness in samsara.

The Treasure Vase: Represents long life, health, wealth, and prosperity.

The White Lotus: Embodies spiritual purity and enlightenment, growing from the mud of samsara.

The Conch Shell: Signifies the spread of Dharma teachings, awakening beings from ignorance.

The Endless Knot: Represents the interconnection of all things and the cycle of rebirth.

The Victory Banner: Symbolizes the triumph of Dharma over negativity and ignorance.

The Wheel of Dharma: Guides beings towards enlightenment with the Noble Eightfold Path.

Bring home this beautiful wall decor and infuse your space with spiritual and material well-being. 
Limited stock available!

제10회 국제불교무용대전이 대학로 성균소극장에서 개최됩니다. 올해는 특히 10주년을 맞이하여 역대 수상자의 축하공연 뿐만 아니라 한국, 인도, 일본 등 아시아 각국의 특색을 보여주는 다양한 무대가 준비되어 있습니다. 불교무용대전은 장르와 국경을 뛰어넘어 불교를 소재로 한 무용 작품이라면 누구나 참여할 수 있는 국제 페스티벌입니다. 전통에서 현대에 이르기까지, 시간을 가로질러 춤을 통해 만날 수 있는 불교무용예술의 아름다운 세계로 여러분을 초대합니다 💃

Caption:
I gave a talk the other day and opened with this story, so I thought I’d share it here.

(It’s pretty straight forward and on the nose for a Zen story, to be fair. Look up the koan ‘Nansen’s cat’ for one a bit more nonsensical 😂).

I know the word ‘mindfulness’ is off putting for some of you. I know, ironically, what images it evokes. But really, REALLY, it’s just cultivating the ability to pay attention, so that we can recognise everything for what it is, what it really is, and live from a place of clarity, instead of being bounced around by the stories we tell ourselves.

There’s doesn’t have to be anything ‘soft’ or esoteric, or even necessarily ‘spiritual’ about it. It’s just having the bravery to step back into not-knowing, letting go of all of our preconceived ideas about the world, and then cultivating the attention to see what’s really here, before we get pulled into the gravity well of our own stories.

#thepathisthegoal #zen #meditation #selfinquiry #mindfulness #buddhism #mindset #mentalhealth
Hashtags: meditation, zen, mentalhealth, mindset, selfinquiry, thepathisthegoal, mindfulness, buddhism

Caption:
𝗧𝗛𝗘 𝗜𝗠𝗠𝗨𝗧𝗔𝗕𝗟𝗘 𝗥𝗘𝗔𝗟𝗜𝗧𝗬

Ignorant beings perceive a universe with a multiplicity of objects subject to constant change. Actually, the perception of the universe is not different from the universe itself because it is this very erroneous perception which creates a universe. When ignorance is dispelled, perception changes, and what was seen as a universe of objects is now seen as an indivisible, immutable space-like reality which absolutely nothing can alter. All thinking and all sensations are nothing but space-like forms. 

Thus, we have in Advaita the following verses:

𝟏.𝟒𝟏. 𝐊𝐧𝐨𝐰 𝐚𝐥𝐥 𝐭𝐡𝐢𝐬 𝐮𝐧𝐢𝐯𝐞𝐫𝐬𝐞 𝐭𝐨 𝐛𝐞 𝐟𝐨𝐫𝐦𝐥𝐞𝐬𝐬. 𝐊𝐧𝐨𝐰 𝐚𝐥𝐥 𝐭𝐡𝐢𝐬 𝐮𝐧𝐢𝐯𝐞𝐫𝐬𝐞 𝐭𝐨 𝐛𝐞 𝐰𝐢𝐭𝐡𝐨𝐮𝐭 𝐜𝐡𝐚𝐧𝐠𝐞. 𝐊𝐧𝐨𝐰 𝐚𝐥𝐥 𝐭𝐡𝐢𝐬 𝐮𝐧𝐢𝐯𝐞𝐫𝐬𝐞 𝐭𝐨 𝐛𝐞 𝐨𝐟 𝐩𝐮𝐫𝐢𝐟𝐢𝐞𝐝 𝐛𝐨𝐝𝐲. 𝐊𝐧𝐨𝐰 𝐚𝐥𝐥 𝐭𝐡𝐢𝐬 𝐮𝐧𝐢𝐯𝐞𝐫𝐬𝐞 𝐭𝐨 𝐛𝐞 𝐨𝐟 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐧𝐚𝐭𝐮𝐫𝐞 𝐨𝐟 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐀𝐛𝐬𝐨𝐥𝐮𝐭𝐞.

𝟏.𝟔𝟕. 𝐈 𝐡𝐚𝐯𝐞 𝐧𝐨 𝐟𝐚𝐮𝐥𝐭 𝐬𝐮𝐜𝐡 𝐚𝐬 𝐩𝐚𝐬𝐬𝐢𝐨𝐧 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐥𝐢𝐤𝐞 - 𝐧𝐨𝐫 𝐡𝐚𝐯𝐞 𝐈 𝐚𝐧𝐲 𝐬𝐨𝐫𝐫𝐨𝐰 𝐚𝐫𝐢𝐬𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐟𝐫𝐨𝐦 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐛𝐨𝐝𝐲. 
𝐊𝐧𝐨𝐰 𝐦𝐞 𝐭𝐨 𝐛𝐞 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐨𝐧𝐞 𝐒𝐞𝐥𝐟, 𝐯𝐚𝐬𝐭 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐥𝐢𝐤𝐞 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐬𝐤𝐲.

𝟏.𝟔𝟖. 𝐅𝐫𝐢𝐞𝐧𝐝 𝐦𝐢𝐧𝐝, 𝐨𝐟 𝐰𝐡𝐚𝐭 𝐮𝐬𝐞 𝐢𝐬 𝐦𝐮𝐜𝐡 𝐯𝐚𝐢𝐧 𝐭𝐚𝐥𝐤? 𝐅𝐫𝐢𝐞𝐧𝐝 𝐦𝐢𝐧𝐝, 𝐚𝐥𝐥 𝐭𝐡𝐢𝐬 𝐢𝐬 𝐦𝐞𝐫𝐞 𝐜𝐨𝐧𝐣𝐞𝐜𝐭𝐮𝐫𝐞. 

𝐈 𝐡𝐚𝐯𝐞 𝐭𝐨𝐥𝐝 𝐲𝐨𝐮 𝐭𝐡𝐚𝐭 𝐰𝐡𝐢𝐜𝐡 𝐢𝐬 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐞𝐬𝐬𝐞𝐧𝐜𝐞:𝐘𝐨𝐮 𝐢𝐧𝐝𝐞𝐞𝐝 𝐚𝐫𝐞 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐓𝐫𝐮𝐭𝐡, 𝐥𝐢𝐤𝐞 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐬𝐤𝐲.

~ 𝐀𝐯𝐝𝐡𝐮𝐭𝐚 𝐆𝐢𝐭𝐚

The same thought is echoed by Dzogchen teacher Vairotsana in his "Five Early Transmissions". The following verse occurs in the section named, "The Eternal Victory Banner”

𝐕𝐞𝐫𝐬𝐞 𝟏𝟏: 𝐓𝐡𝐞 𝐬𝐨𝐥𝐞 𝐜𝐚𝐮𝐬𝐞, 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐨𝐧𝐥𝐲 𝐜𝐨𝐧𝐝𝐢𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧, 𝐢𝐬 𝐢𝐦𝐦𝐮𝐭𝐚𝐛𝐥𝐞,
𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐧𝐞𝐯𝐞𝐫 𝐨𝐫𝐢𝐠𝐢𝐧𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐧𝐠, 𝐢𝐭 𝐜𝐚𝐧 𝐧𝐞𝐯𝐞𝐫 𝐛𝐞 𝐝𝐞𝐬𝐭𝐫𝐨𝐲𝐞𝐝; 𝐢𝐧 𝐭𝐡𝐢𝐬 𝐭𝐢𝐦𝐞𝐥𝐞𝐬𝐬 𝐩𝐫𝐢𝐦𝐨𝐫𝐝𝐢𝐚𝐥 𝐩𝐮𝐫𝐞 𝐞𝐬𝐬𝐞𝐧𝐜𝐞 𝐨𝐟 𝐦𝐢𝐧𝐝,
𝐬𝐩𝐞𝐜𝐮𝐥𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐯𝐞 𝐭𝐡𝐨𝐮𝐠𝐡𝐭-𝐟𝐨𝐫𝐦𝐬 𝐜𝐚𝐧𝐧𝐨𝐭 𝐚𝐟𝐟𝐞𝐜𝐭 𝐛𝐚𝐬𝐢𝐜 𝐒𝐩𝐚𝐜𝐢𝐨𝐮𝐬𝐧𝐞𝐬𝐬.

Caption:
Jangan menyindir orang lain

Banyak orang yang tidak pintar, 
Sering mengucapkan kata-kata sinis untuk menyindir orang lain,
Untuk mengintimidasi orang lain, untuk merendahkan orang lain,

Untuk menonjolkan diri sendiri, *sering membongkar keburukan orang lain, membahas tentang kesalahan orang lain*, 

harus diketahui, yang seperti ini tidak hanya akan kehilangan keberuntungan, 

juga akan menghilangkan berkah diri sendiri.

Xin Ling Fa Men（心灵法门 - XLFM）。Guan Shi Yin Pu Sa。Master Jun Hong Lu（Master Lu）。Guan Yin Citta Dharma Door

Caption:
*Bolehkah sambil makan sambil melafal paritta?*

Pendengar wanita: Kemarin, saya tidak sengaja mendengar Master berkata bahwa boleh melafalkan paritta sambil makan. Bolehkah melafalkan paritta sambil makan?
Master menjawab: Orang yang bervegetarian bisa melafalkan, tetapi orang yang non-vegetarian tidak boleh. Jika mau melafalkan, hanya boleh melafal paritta pendek, tidak boleh melafalkan paritta besar. Seperti paritta Jie Jie Zhou boleh dilafalkan (oh, begitu) Jika ada nama Bodhisattva tidak boleh melafalnya (oh)

wenda20140815 05:12

wenda20140815  05:12  
*可以边吃饭边念经吗*

女听众：上次我无意间好像听到师父说吃饭也可以念经，吃饭可不可以念经啊？
台长答：吃素的人可以念，不吃素的人不能念。要念的话，都是小经，不能念大经，像解结咒这种念念（哦，这样的）有菩萨名字的就不能念了（哦）

Xin Ling Fa Men（心灵法门 - XLFM）。Guan Shi Yin Pu Sa。Master Jun Hong Lu（Master Lu）。Guan Yin Citta Dharma Door

Caption:
네팔에서 구매한 루드락샤로 만든 팔찌*
.
네팔 현지에서 직접 골라온 루드락샤입니다 . 우리나라에서는 보리수다 라고 해서 판매되고있는데 루드락샤는
보리수와 다릅니다. 인도의 루드락샤보다 크고 묵직해서 네팔의 루드락샤다 더 귀하다 합니다. 
이 제품은 가장 기본 무키인 5무키입니다 . 전반적인 건강과 웰빙, 그리고 자유를 위해 좋습니다. 이것은 혈압을 낮추고, 신경을 진정시키며, 신경계에 평온함과 집중력을 가져다 줍니다.
자세한 루드락샤에 대한 얘기는 업로드하겠습니다 🪷
루드락샤와 함께 디자인된 카렌실버와 인도마노석이 잘 어울러져  화려함과 귀여운느낌을 주기도합니다.  팔찌의 연결부위 양끝은 금강저의 모습입니다. 
*모든 제품들은 세상에 하나뿐인 커스텀 핸드메이드입니다 . 

가격 / * 판매완료 *

.
Rudraksha bracelet
.
The Rudraksha beads I have brought directly from Nepal. In Korea, they are sold as ‘Bodhi seeds’, but Rudraksha is different from Bodhi seeds. The Rudraksha from Nepal is larger and heavier than the Indian Rudraksha, so it is considered more precious.

This product is the basic 5-faced Rudraksha. It is good for overall health, well-being, and freedom. It helps lower blood pressure, calm the nerves, and bring peace and focus to the nervous system.

I will upload more detailed information about Rudraksha.

The Rudraksha is designed with Karen silver and Indian agate, which complement each other well, giving a sense of elegance and cuteness. The two ends of the bracelet are in the shape of a Vajra 

*All products are custom handmade, one and only in the world.
.
*Sold out *
.

Master Jun Hong Lu : 

Bervegetarian adalah berkah. Orang yang bervegetarian penuh, akan terhindar dari musibah dan bencana. 

Jika anda bervegetarian sehari, Dewa Pelindung akan melindungi anda sehari.

Anda bervegetarian setiap hari, maka Dewa Pelindung akan melindungi anda setiap hari.

27 Mei 2016

Caption: Went today to this really pretty Buddhist temple called @hsilaitemple  just to see what all the hype was about and I have to say that the temple was a very relaxing and calm place to visit. I did a little prayer in front if this shrine, walked around the WHOLE temple, saw a mini museum of the history of buddhism, saw some pretty gardens located around this shrine. Before you guys do come just a heads up you NEED to dress conservatively as in nothing vulgar or anything showing your body out of respect.  #hsilaitemple #roadtrip #haciendaheights #buddhism #buddha #calmspace #sundayfunday #somethingnew #miniadventure #losangeles
